channel.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?
channel.description:
Hello, I wonder if it's possible to forward MTC messages coming from my digital recorder boss BR-800 (connected via usb) to the MIDI din output... I am trying to sync it with an hardware sequencer (Yamaha qy-700) it is working fine with a computer running linux, I've tried the midithru object but it doesn't seem to work. Any ideas?
Thanks in advance

item.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

emillo:

No registered class for this device.

does not look too promising, although i have to check what it says, when you plug in a usb-midi compliant device

Read full topic

item.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?
item.dc:creator: @emillo
item.description:
@emillo wrote:

No other messages that I know of sadly...

When I plug it in it says

USB Device Attached
PID: 2046h
VID: 451h
Address (#1) assigned.
cfg desc: num interfaces 1
interface: interface 0, num 0, numep 1, class 9 , sub class 0
endpoint: interface 0, ep num 0, addr  81  
Manufacturer : N/A
Product : N/A
Serial Number : N/A
Enumeration done.
This device has only 1 configuration.
Default configuration set.
No registered class for this device.

item.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?
item.dc:creator: @lokki
item.description:
@lokki wrote:

could well be, can you send any other messages from the br-800? what does the console say, when you plug it in?

item.source: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?

item.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?
item.dc:creator: @emillo
item.description:
@emillo wrote:

I've tried both tb/midi/utils/midithru and a773/midithru_incl_clock but it seems that no mtc message is passed through...
There is also the fact that the BR-800 has both midi and audio thru usb, may be this a problem?

thanks

Read full topic

item.title: MTC forwarding from usb to din MIDI?

item.description:
@lokki wrote:

there is a midithru object with added realtime messages, try that
